meanings.definition: A substance that causes a chemical change in another substance when exposed to light.
meanings.sent1: The photosensitizers in the experiment reacted with the light to create a new compound.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use photosensitizers in photography to capture images with light.
meanings.sent3: The photosensitizers at the party made the room glow in a magical way.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like photosensitizers, brightening up the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The photosensitizers in the paint made the artwork come alive under the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A compound that increases the sensitivity of an organism or material to light.
meanings.sent1: The photosensitizers in the lotion made her skin more sensitive to sunlight.
meanings.sent2: Using photosensitizers in sunscreen can help protect the skin from UV rays.
meanings.sent3: The photosensitizers on the flowers made them bloom faster under the sun.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as photosensitizers, making her emotions more intense.
meanings.sent5: The photosensitizers in the fabric made the colors appear brighter in the sunlight.
